name: definition flow variables
info:
The following flow variables are defined:

**mic_status**
- *off* : microphone node is not started or stopped
- *on* :  microphone node is started and producing output

**status**
- *stopped* : waiting until it becomes restarted
- *waiting_for_wake_word* :
- *recording* :
- *recognizing* :

name: setting the light when listening to text
"alarm" Flow Description
info:
## Prerequisites

This flow makes use of the mp3 file: http://soundbible.com/1599-Store-Door-Chime.html

I have used mpg123 to convert it to a wav file.  The location of the wav file is:
> /home/pi/audio/Store_Door_Chime-Mike_Koenig-570742973.wav

## Global variable
The state is kept in the global variable: **alarm ** which can have 2 values: 
- **ringing**
- **stopped**


## MQTT Interface (TO BE IMPLEMENTED)

### Commands
Commands should be sent to **pi3/alarm/cmd**
The following commands are supported:
- **ring** : will ring the alarm
- **stop** : will stop the ringing of the alarm
- **get_status** : will broadcast the event **ringing** or **stopped**  on **pi3/alarm/event**

### Output
Whenever the status changes from **ringing** to **stopped** an event is broadcasted
on **pi3/alarm/event**
The event has the following 2 possible values:
- **ringing**: indicates that the alarm started ringing
- **stopped**: indicates that the ringing has just stopped.


## Issue
1. Current Alarm also triggers snowboy hotword.

## To Do / Ideas
1. Implement also flickering of the voicehat button when alarm goes off
2. Control the volume alarm
3. Control the duration of the alarm
4. Allow to chose different sound for alarm.

name: comments
info:
# Global variables
This flow keeps the global variable `radio_news` up to date.
This variable can have 2 values:
1. `"playing"`
2. `"not_playing"`

# Prerequisites
The command `mplayer` must be installed.

The following command is used to play the radio:
```mplayer -volume 20 http://progressive-audio.lwc.vrtcdn.be/content/fixed/11_11niws-snip_hi.mp3```

# References
https://www.vrt.be/nl/aanbod/kijk-en-luister/radio-luisteren/streamingslinks-radio/

name: Documentation and commands
info:
## Dependencies
Command `amixer`should be installed.
## Commands for the command line
1. Checks the current volume control:
```
amixer
alsamixer
```

2. Sets the volume to 50%
```
amixer sset 'Master' 50%
```
3. Gets the current volume level:
```
amixer sget 'Master'
```

## MQTT interface
### Commands
- **pi3/volume/get** : input parameter is ignored.  Publishes the current volume to pi3/volume/percentage
- **pi3/volume/set** : input parameter is a percentage between 0%  and 100%.  It will set the current volume and also publishes the set volume on pi3/volume/percentage
### output
- **pi3/volume/percentage** : specifies the current volume percentage without % (e.g. 70 to indicate that the volume is currently set to 70%)

## TODOs
- store curren volume in flow variable.

name: Flow documentation
info:
## Prerequisites
### soundmeter
`soundmeter` (https://github.com/shichao-an/soundmeter) must be installed.
This can be done by the following command as specified in https://pypi.org/project/soundmeter/:
```
sudo pip install soundmeter --allow-all-external --allow-unverified pyaudio
```

In order to fix the `OSError: [Errno Input overflowed]` (https://github.com/shichao-an/soundmeter/issues/20)
you have to create following configuration file `~/.soundmeter/config`
with the following content (it is important that the rate is set to 16000 and not 44000)
```
[soundmeter]
frames_per_buffer = 2048
format = 8
channels = 2
rate = 16000
audio_segment_length = 0.5
rms_as_trigger_arg = False
```

Prerequisites
info:
# Music Player Daemon (mpd) installation
This flow requires that `mpd` ( *music player daemon* : https://www.musicpd.org/) must be installed and that
`/etc/mpd.conf` must be adapted as specified in https://www.hackster.io/vvanhee/internet-streaming-radio-with-google-aiy-1edff3

# stopping and starting mpd daemon
mpd can be stopped and started by following commands:
```
sudo systemctl start mpd
sudo systemctl stop mpd
```
The status of the daemon can be checked by following command
```sudo systemctl status mpd```

# log files
The mpd log file is located at:
```
/var/log/mpd/mpd.log
```

# testing mpd installation
mpd can be tested with following command:
```
mpc add http://50.31.180.202:80/
mpc play
```
The following command can be used to stop it:
```
mpc stop
```
# References
https://www.vrt.be/nl/aanbod/kijk-en-luister/radio-luisteren/streamingslinks-radio/

http://progressive-audio.lwc.vrtcdn.be/content/fixed/11_11niws-snip_hi.mp3

info:
This flow is copy pasted from node red flow:
https://flows.nodered.org/flow/e89b677113a337e076cb235f6312f638

This flow requires that *Music Player Daemon* (mpd) is installed and the the `radio.m3u` playlist is created.

Note that I didn't create `radio.m3u` in folder `/home/pi/webradio/` but in folder `/var/lib/mpd/playlists/`

switch on / off more than 10 minutes ago ?
set flow context and payload to switch on aircon
test nodes to check the aircon flow context variables
aircon flow context variables
info:
This flow makes use of 2 flow context variables:
1. *aircon_is_on* : is a boolean indicating if the aircon is currently switched on or off.
2. *aircon_last_switch_tms* : is a timestamp (expressed in number of milli seconds since 1970) of the last time the aircon has been switch on or off.

name: stuff
format:
<style>
  .filled { 
      height: 100% !important;

      padding: 0 !important;
      margin: 0 !important;
  }
  .nr-dashboard-template {
      padding: 0;
      margin: 0;
  }
  
  .rounded {
  border-radius: 12px 12px 12px 12px;
}
 
   .bigfont {
  font-size: 18px;
}

   .smallfont {
  font-size: 12px;
}
  
</style>

<script>
$('.vibrate').on('click', function() {
  navigator.vibrate(100);
});

function restore_bg(x) {
            $(this).css("background-color", x);
    };

$('.touched').on('mousedown', function() {
    
    var x= $(this).css("background-color");
    $(this).css("background-color", "yellow");
    
    setTimeout(restore_bg.bind(this,x),100);
    navigator.vibrate(80);
    });
    
</script>
